content: where does one sign up for track(s) for the HL7 Connectathon in Baltimore next month?
I think we haven't set that up yet
@David Hay ? :)
well, you have to register with HL7 of course - then the spreadsheet is here: https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1rrz8yqkG5gHhSEzUvZxP-6_CCFr_6F0FUElFRGmObyw/edit
thank you
for patient track at connectathon is STU2 support sufficient? Or are there changes to Patient resource in current build? thanks
Changes to Patient resource since DSTU2 - http://hl7-fhir.github.io/patient.html#resource - R2 Diff tab
thanks @Aleksandra Pavlyshina
also, changes the RESTful API - the main relevant one is the change to the mime type

For anyone who can't be there in person, we're going to have a webinar up so you can see the kick-off and the presentations - and the general milling about in between. The link is: https://attendee.gotowebinar.com/register/7818733115499491330
Re-posting the Webinar link in case anyone missed it the first time: : https://attendee.gotowebinar.com/register/7818733115499491330

And in case this helps:
1. Please join my Webinar.
https://global.gotowebinar.com/register/231148459

2. You will be connected to audio using your computer's microphone and speakers (VoIP). A headset is recommended.

Or, you may select "Use Telephone" after joining the Webinar.

Dial +1 (415) 655-0060
Access Code: 264-222-093
Audio PIN: Shown after joining the webinar

Webinar ID: 231-148-459

GoToWebinar®
Webinars Made Easy®
Hi, I attended the connectathon (Genomics group), I was wondering if the slides/video of the results (last part of Sunday's session) are going to be published?
I'm sorry - that's a task on me and I've been a bit sluggish...
HQ is working on getting the video up. (90+MB :))

The video of the presentations has now been posted. You can find it here: https://www.pathlms.com/hl7/courses/3390
The coupon code to watch it for free is: i0jgbfwdoi

I haven't watched it, so no promises on video/audio quality
The code does work... Im watching it... Streaming or download mp4. Video is good quality, audio is just about useless.
Audio is good sometimes. Good at minute 20 when Cerner presents. again good at the Patch presentation.
Well worth every penny paid... Thanks for the upload and the coupon code... and beggars can't be choosers.
@David Hay and @Lloyd McKenzie , thank you!

Hi Guys - have uploaded the reports for some of the tracks (payer extract, genomics & provider directories) to slideshare, and then provided a link to them from the track proposals (The report link is directly after the name of the track lead).

Could I ask that the other track leads do the same with their reports? (or - just embed the report into the proposal if that's all that's required).

cheers...
David Hay, what and where is 'slideshare'?, nevermind, I see you posted the link.

Hi Guys,

As you may be aware, our connectathons are organized into tracks, each of which has a coordinator responsible for the smooth running of the track.

I'm generally responsible for the patient track, but won't be at the WGM in January, so we (FMG) are seeking interest from people wanting to take on that role in January.

The following link (http://wiki.hl7.org/index.php?title=201609_Patient_Track_Proposal ) has a description of the track, along with a link to the responsibilities of the track co-ordinator.

We're imagining that the role would suit someone who has been to a couple (or more) connectathon in the past, is familiar with FHIR and is looking to get more involved with the running of the event.

If you're interested - then let me know via this channel - or by email (david.hay25@gmail.com) so we can choose a victim - sorry, successor - at the FMG meeting next week.

cheers...
David, you can throw my name into the hat. I would be happy to help out as the coordinator for the patient track. Thanks.
David, I sent you a separate email response and this is to confirm that I am interested in helping out as the Patient Testing Track lead. Thanks.
